topic: Deep dive: _ssl standard library module in Python 3.12+
prompt: Write a Python 3.12+ focused, accurate explainer for: Deep dive: _ssl standard library module in Python 3.12+

response_parsed.title: _ssl Standard Library Module in Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This explainer delves into the enhancements and key features of the _ssl standard library module in Python 3.12+.

code_examples.code:
from _ssl import SSLContext
context = SSLContext(protocol=TLSv1_3)
netsock = context.wrap_socket(socket, server_hostname='example.com')

import ssl
context = ssl.create_default_context(ssl.Purpose.CLIENT_AUTH)
context.verify_mode = ssl.CERT_REQUIRED
socket = context.wrap_socket(socket, server_hostname='example.com')

version_notes: Compatibility issues with older versions of Python
caveats: Always verify SSL certificates to prevent man-in-the-middle attacks
Ensure proper handling of exceptions when working with SSL connections
